_comment: Created by EFisher on 17/02/2016 18:38:54 using v2.7
title: Which organisations are responsible for the number of delayed days?
analysis_commentary:
The total number of delayed days accrued in a month when the delay is attributable to NHS organisations has increased by approximately 46 per cent and by 43 per cent when both organisations are responsible.

The length of delays that patients are likely to experience when social care organisations are responsible for the delay has overall increased by 29 per cent. It was fairly static between August 2010 and February 2015 and ranged between 27,654 and 40,036. However, after February 2015 the number of delayed days begins to increase at a far greater rate than it has done previously and over the next 10 months up to December 2015 this was an extra 14,705 days per month (a 42 per cent increase).
